intro: Strychnos flacurtii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its toxic compounds, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
